nl.weeaboo.vn.text

Interface IMultiLineText

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IText
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ITextDrawable, ITextRenderer, ITextRenderState

    public interface IMultiLineText
extends IText

    • Method Detail

      • getStartLine

        int getStartLine()
        Returns:
        The index of the first visible line.

      • getEndLine

        int getEndLine()
        The visible lines range from [start, end). Te end line is the first line index that is no longer rendered.

      • getLineCount

        int getLineCount()
        Returns:
        The number of lines in the current text layout.

      • getGlyphOffset

        int getGlyphOffset(int line)
        Returns:
        The glyph offset at which the requested line starts.

      • getMaxWidth

        double getMaxWidth()
        Word-wrap width for this multi-line text

      • getMaxHeight

        double getMaxHeight()
        Maximum visible height for this multi-line text. Lines that lie (partially) outside the maximum visible area will not be rendered.

      • setMaxSize

        void setMaxSize(double w,
                double h)
        Sets the maximum size; the visible rectangle in which the multi-line text is rendered.
        See Also:
        getMaxWidth(), getMaxHeight()

      • getTextWidth

        float getTextWidth()
        Returns:
        The minimum bounding text width for the currently visible lines.

      • getTextHeight

        float getTextHeight()
        Returns:
        The minimum bounding text height for the currently visible lines.
        See Also:
        getTextHeight(int, int)

      • getTextHeight

        float getTextHeight(int startLine,
                    int endLine)
        Returns the minimum bounding text height for the requested line range.

      • getLineBounds

        nl.weeaboo.common.Rect2D getLineBounds(int lineIndex)
        Returns:
        The bounding box of the text in the requested line, relative to the origin of the entire text layout (not just the visible part).

      • calculateTextHeight

        double calculateTextHeight(double widthHint)
        Calculates the text height given a set width.
